Let s get one thing straight Parasite is phenomenal It s a stunning subtle and immensely powerful piece on class warfare and the nature of the human condition It s also a tense funny extremely entertaining film that didn t feel its length at all Go into it without knowing anything if you can it made my viewing experience all the more exciting But with that said I didn t really like the ending Tons of details character arcs and storylines felt like they were dropped in an instant And yeah I know that was the point But I d be lying if I said the lack of resolution given to certain characters is something I m happy about Like for how well set up and intriguing Ki jeong s sociopathic tendencies are THAT S what you do with her I don t expect my disappointment with the ending to subside with time but don t let that dissuade you from seeing this film It s still excellent and I m looking forward to seeing it again It s pretty much everything Jordan Peele s Us should have been

review_title: Movie script of Parasite is clearly stolen from Taiwan But it is good show
review_comment: The movie script of Parasite is clearly taken from Taiwanese president Tsai Ing Wen s London School of Economic and Political Science LSE Ph D Degree investigation by commentator of True Voice of Taiwan Dennis Peng Ph D and American Journalist Michael Richardson Tsai claims she received 1 5 Ph D degree from LSE in 1984 but The Council of the London School of Economics and Political Science in a November 26th 2021 statement to British Information Commissioner s Office denies that LSE have Tsai Ing wen s Ph D thesis examiners names and date of examination Oddly enough that Tsai s application to New York attorney license in 1987 did not even mention that she has 1 5 Ph D degree from the University All these evidences point to Tsai never received any Ph D degree from the University of London neither one or one and a half Currently Taiwanese is prohibited from looking into Tsai higher academic records by an order from Tsai s government the order seals her records from public eye for thirty years Dr Peng is a fugitive wanted by Tsai government and currently in exile in the US LSE records show in Tsai s own writing that Tsai dropped out of LSE Ph D programme in 1983 because of financial difficulty She returned to Taiwan and began to fabricate her credentials to gain various higher posts Tsai s scam came to light in 2015 but failed to wake Taiwanese this is the timeline when the Korean film maker picked up the story Soon after Tsai took power Taiwan s National Communication Commission NCC began to clamp down news outlets and shut a TV station to quiet the dissenting voices Also Taiwan s Central Election Commission is now run by a Democratic Progressive Party leader known to falsify legal document and the commission is staffed with Eagle Eye troopers who are the most avid supporters of Tsai The impact of DPP control of the electoral commission is evident by the passages of importing of European Union banned ractopamine containing pork into Taiwan and destruction of a unique 7500 years coral reef the destruction of reef carries a huge if not irreversible ecologic impact that may lead to the loss of a global treasure Every Taiwanese knows the movie Parasite is poking fun at Taiwan for its fame for protecting scammers Taiwanese strongly objects the Korean film maker publicize President Tsai s scandal and morph her story into a movie for monetary gain and to shame Taiwan While enjoying the film but I also felt the hurt that Korean pouring on Taiwan

A fussy poor Korean family demonstrates that class divisions can never be overcome A leisurely thriller that keeps you in suspense but never gets sinister just powerfully develops the characters stories until the eventual denouement Parasite is fantastic It s clever It s funny It s disturbing And yes there is a powerful underlying theme here of the gap between rich and poor But that theme is so cleverly woven into the fabric of the plot that you don t think about it until the fateful scene before the last act The film fully deserves an Oscar for best picture and direction If only for the peach fuzz fight scene

Such films are very multifaceted you can look at them from different sides so it s safe to say that after watching each viewer will extract a unique emotion and impressions for himself Secondly not every film of this genre will go to everyone since the creators of these creations do not set themselves to reach a large target audience Recently I was able to view and evaluate it About this movie I heard in a long time and now I can confidently recommend almost every fan of good cinema with meaning In order to better reveal the storyline and subject matter of the film I propose to consider the main characters around which the narrative is constructed which can be divided into two groups of poor and rich One of the features of the film is a coup by the director of several genres at once At the very beginning of the film it s like a crime comedy but then the notes of a thriller and drama are already revealed In general the movie is a buzz Look you won t regret it

review_title: The film begins with a story about infantile adults, a traditional family consisting of mom, dad and adult children of different sexes, who sit around the clock in a stuffy ba
review_comment: The film begins with a story about infantile adults a traditional family consisting of mom dad and adult children of different sexes who sit around the clock in a stuffy basement penniless stealing neighbor s Wi Fi aki parasites And it s not for nothing that the mention begins with mom she is the clear leader of the family and although the tenderness is not visible on the screen but the unspoken unity that unites this family immediately catches the eye They stand for each other like a mountain The film has elements of comedy and black humor detective and thriller there is something from horror and something from horror films but in fact this is a very important action drama that gives incredible food for the mind and space for imagination I liked Parasites I watched them twice This happens rarely I recommend it to those who can distract themselves from clip thinking for 2 hours and watch a rather unhurried movie Unhurried does not mean slow There are a lot of episodes in it when people show cunning and use manipulation There are many moments when everyday life is shown and when the plot turns in an unexpected direction at all I love all this

review_title: This film made me excited every minutes.
review_comment: Parasite was directed by Bong Joon ho and tells the story of a down on their luck family that takes a special interest in a very wealthy family everyone in this family is unemployed and slowly but surely they find a way to all get jobs working for this wealthy family in very private positions a driver a housekeeper a tutor and the whole time this other family has no idea that all these people are related and scamming them But when something rather unexpected happens it changes both families lives forever I excited every minute of the film it s extremely funny in essence It s a social satire because we re watching two very different families and how they perceive things the characters we follow who are sort of scamming these rich people literally live lower than the others they live farther down in the city when there s a rain storm the wealthy people think it s beautiful but for these guys they re thinking that s a bad luck our whole neighborhoods going to flood and where this film shines is that so much of this is told through visuals we get this great sequence where this family is trudging through a flood trying to get back to their home and we just have these incredible images playing out on the screen with beautiful breathtaking cinematography of the city and seeing how people from a certain area are looking at this rainstorm versus people who have to take buckets and get water out of their rooms through the window because their entire house is filling with sewage like in the opening sequence the family notices that their neighborhood is being fumigated for rodents and bugs and stuff and they leave the windows open because if all of this mist gets into their house which the poor family could not refuse This movie shows two families with very different backgrounds And it shows that poor families want to be better

This movie gets a reward Oscar winning Korean films In our society there is a class difference between the affluent and the poor which is reflected in this film The main character are Song Kang ho Lee Sun kyun Cho Yeo jeong Choi Woo shik Park So dam Jang Hye jin and Lee Jung eun Storyline of Parasite movie there was a poor family that wanted to make enough money by working in the homes of wealthy people by as a teacher a servant or a driver but found another family lurking in the basement of a rich family s home In the movie first A poor family have 4 persons that lives in a ramshackle semi basement apartment One day the son wants to work and he has a friend for help him to get a job Therefore he gets the job teach the child of a wealthy family After that he see the chance for take him family to work together So he convinces his sister and his parents to join him as teacher driver and a servant in an affluent family In the middle of movie poor family found another family lurking in the basement and then they are killing each other At the last point his father lurking in the basement and him buy a home from wealthy family In my opinion I think a movie plot so surprising because in first we can t know about flashing light in the house but we know in the end of the story flashing light is a morse code that use for communicating with other In the part of actor s show is so professional and that great when putting emotion in front of the camera In the composition of movie I think that can reflect a class difference between the affluent and the poor people good In a part of music in movie give a feeling of sobriety and thriller with movie In my personal suggestion if you unlike a blood you should be careful because in this movie have a tragedy My personal film rating Overall score 9 10 Story line 8 10 Character 9 10 Movie soundtrack 9 10

It s a movie that keeps you hooked from start to finish The introductory part of the film is excellent explaining and describing the situation of the family which does not tire the viewer but which invites him to continue watching and accompanies him in the development of the film I ve always wanted to see this film and I must admit that before I saw it I had no idea what it could tell This film amazed me even more than I would have thought an excellent narration unpredictable and really well studied I find amazing the transition from the drama of the introductory part which almost resembles a documentary about the family situation to the thriller of the second half of the film Furthermore it is not obvious that a thriller film ends so well many films of this genre are often left hanging without even having a sequel which however did not happen in this one It made a devastating and chaotic ending enjoyable Simply brilliant and unpredictable The best thriller film of the last four years

Absolute masterpiece Makes me want to learn Korean just so I don t have to pay as much attention to the captions This film does a great job holding you in suspense for the entire time I cannot recommend it enough It s pacing done well Multiple stories and details are woven together so beautifully

review_title: Bong Joon-ho makes produces yet another masterpiece
review_comment: Parasite is a visually and emotionally stunning experience like no other film and undeniably meets all the criteria in order to be called a masterpiece Having won many awards at the 92nd Academy Awards like Best International Feature Film this movie is an absolute gem because of its acting cinematography and its relatability Based in Korea the greatest deceitful scheme yet of the Kim family begins to unravel in many unexpecting ways that leave the audience stunned Parasite offers a wide range of talented actors that advanced the story overall creating such believable families The cinematography is award winning that helps support the main theme through the use of its unbelievable camera angles and lighting Its ability to relate to the audience is what truly grants this film a must watch alongside its technical aspects It s an insightful look into the universal idea of inequality among different classes of people that generally affects everyone globally All these fundamental elements artfully woven together give the impression of an entirely new movie experience which makes it stand above the rest

Everything scary is going to happen slowly snd there is no fear for director to show dirty sides of humans The most important reason that makes the film Parasite admirable at first glance is the way Bong Jung Ho looks at the poor family in the film Something like the look Koreida had in the movie Shoplifters Depicting people who although they live in the basement although they are poor and do not have proper jobs but they are by no means lost and hopeless people The basic question that is ironically expressed in the film is why a family with such intelligence is so poor and their place is underground

review_title: One of the best films of all time.
review_comment: Parasite is one of the greatest and most influential films of all time It is a great thrilling satire and connects you with the characters and storyline It is the perfect example of how beautiful a film can be and how playful it is with satire These are one of the films you wish you could watch over and over again a film unmasking itself each minute This is what makes Parasite so great It s ratings satisfy me greatly and it deserved best picture for 2019 I absolutely love this film and I do not stammer with any other South Korean films being placed over it or fought with Parasite unless we are talking about OldBoy Although I prefer Parasite the more entertaining one

Parasite 2019 is a brilliant masterpiece that explores the theme of social class and inequality through the story of a poor family the Kims who infiltrate the lives of a wealthy family the Parks through deceit and cunning The film is a masterclass in storytelling cinematography and acting and it rightfully won the Palme d Or at the 2019 Cannes Film Festival and the Best Picture at the 2020 Academy Awards Director Bong Joon ho expertly weaves a complex narrative that is both suspenseful and emotionally gripping The film starts with the Kims living in a dingy basement struggling to make ends meet However their luck changes when the son Ki woo lands a job as an English tutor for the Parks daughter From there the Kims plot their way into the Parks lives taking on various roles as tutor driver and housekeeper But as they grow more entrenched they begin to uncover the dark secrets hidden within the Parks mansion The cinematography by Hong Kyung pyo is stunning with each shot masterfully framed to highlight the stark contrast between the Kims cramped living quarters and the Parks spacious mansion The use of light and shadow creates a sense of unease and tension that builds throughout the film The performances by the cast are outstanding with each actor bringing depth and nuance to their characters Song Kang ho who plays the father of the Kim family is particularly outstanding with his naturalistic acting style and subtle expressions conveying a range of emotions Overall Parasite is a thought provoking and engaging film that offers a scathing critique of the class divide in modern society With its expert storytelling stunning cinematography and outstanding performances it is a must see film that will leave a lasting impact on viewers long after the credits have rolled

review_title: Just something you wouldn't think at first place...
review_comment: This movie is so relatable if you belong to a middle class family with unexpected ending I felt connected and engaged with alot of characters in the movie There are alot of scenes which were so true about high class society people I love watching foreign language movies having a lit of different topics and real life struggles This was actually an original dark comedy about class struggles Please do try to watch award winning shows and movies which contain sensitive topics and real life struggles Here I am trying to convince you guys to watch PARASITE and thank me later You will love this film

This movie s story was brilliant however it felt rushed I was confused about what the plot was until a little less than 90 minutes in out of a 2 hour movie The real story it reveals is very engaging but it doesn t start until at least 60 40 minutes in From my understanding of the plot there could have been at least 10 minutes cut short from the beginning and the story would still be fine It had trouble engaging me The rising action wasn t rising for me until 10 minutes before the climax it felt The ending and climax were worth it but waiting two hours felt too long If anyone could explain why some scenes are important I d love to know but other than that it s just good Could have been better and could have been worse I do think this is a good movie to watch and I do recommend it

review_title: A foreign film that communicates globally
review_comment: I regret not watching this movie sooner This film made me wonder if it really exists all because it is such a distinct and unique plot at the same time told in a splendid way The mystery is satisfying and the horror is impeccable He is a perfect example of the bubble that nobles live in in society and the lack of empathy that overlaps both sides Every cut and every scene was perfectly timed In a plot with a long duration I didn t lose my concentration even once We have here a majestic representation of the conflict between social classes We don t need to speak in English to represent something that happens all over the world

review_title: Though a clich descriptor, this film truly does 'hold a mirror up to society'
review_comment: This review will contain as fewer plot spoilers as possible but just in case I ll put the spoiler warning on as a precaution I m more basing this review on the films message and it s brutal yet earnest look on how society views classism This film is a beautiful window into societies socially charged economic hierarchy Though the villainized upper class are the victims in our story you can t help but feel morally conflicted while watching this film You feel inclined to applaud the main families resourcefulness while also being forced to acknowledge the damage they cause to the livelihoods of the innocent bystanders For me this film really made me question the class system generally I came away from the experience feeling a wide range of conflicting emotions But most prominently satisfied Whether it was the perfectly placed comedy the sudden emotional transitions the beautiful settings the acting or even the perfectly appropriate title across it s 132 minute runtime everything about this film is a masterpiece a true 10 If I had to describe this film s message in 1 simple phrase it would be what truly is the difference between desperation and greed

review_title: Parasite: Art in its perfect form
review_comment: Parasite is one of those films that you watch once but must rewatch it multiple times to fully understand all the content layered into the film The film is about two families living in vastly different classes who interact with each other in a very peculiar way The Kim s are a poor family living in South Korea finding any feasible way to earn enough money to get by life The Kim s find multiple ways to work for a wealthy family The Parks by being housekeepers tutors and drivers by intentionally getting the previous workers fired through malicious acts Through the film we come to learn that their plans of overtaking all the previous workers positions begin to introduce complications which later leads to total chaos I believe that this film is one of the most meaningful and most intricate films ever made Ranging from Writing and Cinematography to the Topics covered this film does not fail to capture every emotion intended to be displayed by the director The theme about class in the film is very present and gives a deeper dive into how classism can affect both ends of the spectrum of class There is also another theme about how people will use other people for their own advantage thus the name Parasite I will be focusing on the writing and cinematography in the film to evaluate how this film perfects ambience mood and the meaning of the film The screen writing in Parasite really helps capture the mood and tone of the movie In the beginning of the film we are presented with an almost comedy like movie where the characters are being introduced but we get a good understanding of what the characters are going through For example we are introduced to the Kim s which are struggling to make a living and we learn about their struggles with money and finding work in almost an unserious way It makes the viewer feel disconnected with their struggles I believe the way this is presented is on purpose for the fact that we only want to be introduced to the characters and not grow a relationship with them Later in the movie once we see the plans of the Kim s start to fail we are shifted into a more serious and dark tone It is remarkably interesting how we can go from not feeling a connection to the characters in the beginning to feeling like we are involved in the demise of the Kim s This switch up in emotions is possible due to the screenwriting as well as the Cinematography The cinematography really captures everything the writing was not able to fully express Throughout the film I began to learn that The Kim s and The Park s have scenes filmed personally for each family When we are viewing solely the Kim s during the film the scenes feel very intimate with the settings feeling tight and making us feel like we are involved with their every move This really helps capture the ambience of the film The cinematography also does an excellent job in displaying the topics covered by the film such as class and classism Whenever we see the Park s we see them from a distance and in an elevated perspective to add the affect that they are higher in class than the Kim s The cinematography is also able to capture the topic of class whenever we see the families using stairs as when the Kim s use the stairs they are always descending a flight of stairs and whenever the Park s use stairs they are always ascending from it The camera shots of these scenes capture the topic of class as it can be interpreted that because the Kim s are in the lower class they are descending further into poverty and the opposite for the Park s Overall I believe that because of how the film s writing and cinematography perfectly captures the tone and emotions intended to be conveyed this is a movie I recommend everyone watch at some point in their lives There is so much meaning behind why every scene was filmed or written the way it is and I encourage everyone to watch this film and form their own opinions about the film This film is a refreshing take on thrillers which leaves the viewer thinking about it for a while after watching it

Parasite I think the most brilliant part of this film is the construction of 3 spaces the house lived by Park s family the basement lived by Kim Ki woo s family and the basement under the house which is lived by the original housekeeper s husband The design of the 3 spaces is a metaphor for the difference in the classes of the 3 family Every time Kim Ki woo goes to the house to teach the girl he has to go on a slope And when the family run away from the house they have to go down stairs The rich people living in the house can see the sunshine and grassland while the family living in the basement can only see passerby s foot and the man living under the house can never see anything outside that basement The movie indicates the different living conditions between people in different classes And the design of the spaces also matches the title of the movie which is the parasite Kim Ki woo s family lives like a parasite They hide themselves under the table listening the complaints about their smell from the rich What between the different spaces is the line that can t be crossed The movie constructed an illusion that the poor living in the rich s house and enjoy the life as the rich does However the illusion is broken and all of the poor come back to the real world when the real rich come home In the real world those rich people have not only wealth but power They utilize those who want to climb up and push them when they near the top It reflects the hidden unfairness in the capitalism The owner of the power creates a dream for those down on the ground and encourage them to climb up But everything end up as foam It is just like what the movie The Great Gatsby which talks about a man s dream breaks

Parasite is a cinematic marvel that goes beyond mere storytelling to deliver a deeply resonating commentary on the class disparities that pervade modern society Directed by the brilliantly inventive Bong Joon Ho the film effectively intertwines elements of drama comedy and thriller to create an experience that lingers long after the screen goes dark The narrative centers on two contrasting families and through them explores the complex dynamics of wealth poverty and human tendency It s a masterly crafted web of intrigue that keeps the viewer engrossed and constantly on edge The screenplay is astoundingly unpredictable and the sharp crisp dialogue effectively builds tension while maintaining its dark humor The cast delivers stellar performances that bring their layered characters to life Each actor stands out portraying their varied characters with precision be it the cunning yet charismatic poor family or the oblivious yet complicated wealthy family The somber atmospheric cinematography coupled with the haunting score creates an increasingly uneasy ambiance that height

review_title: Despite its lengthy 2 hour run, film keeps relentless pace that keeps viewers engrossed
review_comment: Parasite is a remarkable masterpiece that captured the hearts of millions world wide and rightfully earned its Oscar winning status for Best Picture Directed by Bong Joon ho it portrays a grippingly raw story of class struggle with incredible cinematography and exceptional acting The movie is immaculately shot and the director brilliantly uses various elements of filmmaking to create an unsettling atmosphere of tension humor and horror The ensemble of actors delivered top notch performances seamlessly coming together to tell a thrilling and captivating story Parasite is an unforgettable and remarkable cinematic experience that challenges traditional narratives and leaves a powerful impact It s a must see masterpiece that sets a high bar for cinema and that too without feeling like a long drawn out affair

After leaving the movie it makes you think Parasite made history by winning Oscars for best screenplay best film and best director independent of the actor As the first foreign film it broke new ground in this sense in addition to winning the Best Film Oscar Because there is no film in Oscar history whose actors have achieved a hat trick without receiving any awards While the lower class becomes blind by ignoring their situation by not rebelling against the economic order from the parasitic settlement and reality around the bourgeoisie In this movie he is blind because of the drunkenness brought by the extravagant life What I told you is only a small part of it That s exactly why this movie is so important

review_title: Very very as in VERY good!
review_comment: It s actually perfect for an international scene because the theme is relevant in every society but also because it plays with the western world view of how we all think Korea is regarding everything American cool Yet at the same time it s making fun of all people in the West at the same time It is like a giant f finger in our face this is how a movie should be composed so go back to your banal predictable styles and continue as you were You have not seen this one coming It s clever and cute in its persona gallery We are sitting there waiting for someone to hate but somehow come to like all the characters 5 min into the movie you have forgotten that it s a Korean cast and the language is unknown to you Something that impressed me The sad ending is somehow terrible because it s real This is life and it s Hollywood to think it would be any different I truly love the originality and full circle of the script it s like if you write a master thesis that just hits home where you were able to tie all knots elegantly and with great content I loved this movie And I actually can t remember if I ever saw something this original and mind blowing which was not sci fi
It really does live up to the hype truly a great film

Loved every second of this movie It starts off as a comedy drama of a family trying to survive by whatever means possible Then when the son lands a job through a friends recommendation it adds romance and delves into the world of the rich family which contrasts the lifestyle and ideals of the poor In that segment it plays with social ideas and it shows you how clean and mighty the rich are but later throughout conversations they have their true colors begin to shown Out of nowhere it throws you into a survival situation where the old house maiden comes back but i don t want to spoil this part And last it throws a bit of action at your face All of this genre hopping but one thing was always present The parody I felt anxious a lot throughout the film and i loved how the Title of the film had an allegorical meaning and it was changing depending on the situation part of the film you are on The last minutes of the film how it was written narrated and being setup are the most importand part of the film Without that scene this movie could have been a completely different thing

Easily one of the best movies I ve ever seen You ve never seen a movie quite like X Such a statement has become overused to such a degree that it s impossible to be taken seriously like how too many major new movies are gifted the m word masterpiece So how do critics convey when a film truly is unexpectedly brilliantly unpredictable in ways that feel revelatory And what do we do when we see an actual masterpiece in this era of critics crying wolf Especially one with so many twists and turns that the best writing about it will be long after spoiler warnings aren t needed I ll do my best because Bong Joon ho s Parasite is unquestionably one of the best films of the year Just trust me on this one

review_title: genial way of illustrating social layers
review_comment: Parasite represents the example of a movie illustrating the social gap between the poor and the rich With it s absurd language utilizes a lot of theatrical elements I recommend this to everyone who wants to laugh and cry at the same time This movie will make you think about your place in society but it will not make you sorry for occupying that place There are a lot of movies about thic topic but most of them take themselves too seriously and their goal is to awake guilt in the spectator thus the true message will be hidden under that feeling In contrary Parasite uses the language of humor irony and absurdity I think Bertolt Brecht would be proud of this masterpiece
The mastery of time and space is ingenious It reflects the opposition between the rich and the poor exposing the frustration of the bottom society
The architectural design of the building has made a special contribution to the film

Amazing music amazing plot fantastic pacing which really makes you pay attention throughout the whole movie Interesting story with some deepness to it I live in Denmark and thankfully the distance between the lower and upper class is honestly not that big and the perspective Parasite gave me made me appreciate this even more I also appreciate the directors continuous comment on global warming like in Snowpiecer another film I enjoyed the difference between how the rich and the poor handles rain is brilliant and the way that enter sequence was filmed really was outstanding Parasite is definitely my favourite movie of his so far
The plot of this film is captivating The cinematography is simply amazing I ll be watching this title several times a year

The cinematic excellence of this film is one of a kind It has such an original approach to its meaning and thought process for each scene This film is one like no other The fact that it has subtitles adds to the raw feeling and authenticity of the film Giving each character a real element It has so many genuinely intelligent plays you have to watch it more than once to explore its excellence The first time you watch it you will be captured by the emotional and breathtaking journey it takes you on and then the second time you will be able to appreciate the brilliance of each mirrored scene each tactical foreshadow and each hint that as a first time watcher you would be sure to miss It has an outstanding in depth analysis and projection of the upper and lower class separations each one of these being shown throughout and uniquely Highly highly recommended I will keep this film as one of my greats for a long long time
Lovely lineup a great way to present data in a short interval Title matches with story

In the opening scene the family is underground where is sad and dark povert as Kim s family moves toward they move in to the light hope wealth how ever when the things fall apart light disappeared and the family moves back to darkness the final shot reflects the firts one but now is way more darker Also when the rain star they ran many stairs signifying that they are going back to where they come from And also in the begging the dad said he hates cockroaches but at the end he becomes one

This movie was immensely fun to watch My wife and I heard a lot of buzz around this so we decided to give it a watch for ourselves Acting was a 10 10 with a unique story that was executed 10 10 with fantastic cinematography and directing 10 10 I can t say enough about this movie it s a MUST WATCH On a side note going into the movie me and the wife watched the trailer but didn t get much out of it GOOD The less you know going into this the more you will enjoy it

A milestone in Korean cinema Amazing set design and symbolism Bong is a genius This films have gotten everything to keep you hooked For me this film has all the basic of cinema and Bong have really mastered it
I like it very very very very very very very very very much

review_title: A masterpiece in South Korean filmmaking
review_comment: Bong Joon ho s Parasite hits all the right notes It s characters story twists and turns really drive home an unforgettable experience 10 10

review_title: Light-hearted and heavy, comical and shocking
review_comment: I feel like this film deserves all the praise it gets It is nearly impossible to say what genre this one belongs in there are just so many contradicting emotions As with perhaps any film try to watch this with as little knowledge as possible and prepare for a rollercoaster

During the Coronavirus Quarantine I ve watch this movie although it s in Korean i still liked the movie

review_title: Subtle and subversive depiction of the society
review_comment: With not a moment that seems unnecessary or extra Parasite is exceptionally well paced and edited Yang Jin mo Director Bong Jon ho masterfully constructs stylized dramatic sequences set to a brilliant background score Jung Jae il as the film rapidly moves from one plot point to another It results in a gripping yet poignant watch The ensemble cast enhance the proceedings with superlative performances especially Song Kang ho Park So dam and Choi Woo shik With an insightful and searing exploration of human behavior Parasite is a masterfully crafted film that is a definite must watch
Nothing more needs be said about this movie If you haven t watched it yet do so immediately
Depicts the life thinking and work culture of people living in a slum in a very crude sense

I went in thinking it would be completely over hyped and that the park family would be archetypal immoral rich people but all the characters were well rounded and although I didn t share Mr Kim s viewpoint it is completely understandable Parasite got its message across without being textbook rich people bad post modernist drivel I didn t feel like my class was being criticized for no reason The whole 2nd half had my jaw on the floor and gripping my seat while the 1st half had my laughing every few lines This movie is well worth the watch and entirely lived up to the hype

review_title: The best film in the last decade
review_comment: I am remarkably stingy with my 10 10 ratings I ll be the first person to acknowledge this If this isn t a masterpiece then I don t know what is I was really excited to see it progress and unfold in satisfying unexpected ways Never expected from the cast to director I forced my friends to watch and everybody agreed with me
This movie is damn masterpiece fun darkcomedy oneofthebestmovie such a different concept

review_title: Finest example of world class cinema
review_comment: It is one of best film i watched It brilliantly shows the greed dark secrets and other emotions
Parasite is one of the best films in 2019 and the trailer goes in a completely different direction and does not spoil the whole film
This movie had me terrified the entire time which is incredibly rare Easy 10 I ve never experienced something like this
